Posts.Title: Viet Nam and Agent Orange

Posts.Content: My husband originally thought radiation, but if that didn't work, then surgery was not an option. And honestly, he wanted the cancer out of his body asap, so he can go on with life. He's 6 months post op. Does not leak at all. As far as sex goes, has it changed? Yes. But it is soooooo much better than I ever thought it would be prior to surgery. I think the lack of spontaneity is the biggest change because he does the Trimix injections, we have to plan intercourse. There is life in his penis so as time goes on, we hope we can use a combination of pills and Trimix. I think this sums up our sex life pretty well after surgery. After a particularly wonderful afternoon, he held me and said he knows we don't make love as often, but each time is better and better and he loves me more everyday. I'm glad he chose surgery and now we can focus on life again.

Posts.Title: Why Not a Prostatectomy?

Posts.Content: My husband had a PSA in the 2's for 4 years before he was diagnosed. Any test can vary by some degree. In fact, if you had two PSA tests from the same blood draw, they could still vary that much. My husband's PSA also went up 1 point once when we had sex prior to the test and wasn't told not to. He also sat on a plane for hours and in meetings. Lots of pressure down there. He had it retested the next week and it was back down to where it had been. So, relax, enjoy the holidays and try not to think about it. I know, kind of like a red elephant.

Posts.Content: My understanding is it has nothing to do with healing the nerves. That is simply time. The purpose of Cialis,Viagra and Levitra is to keep blood flow going into the penis so the tissue does not atrophy and die wihile waiting for the nerves to heal. That therapeutic dose for blood flow is low and shouldn't have side effects. Hubby takes 2.5mgs every night. Night time is best so it's strength is strongest and simulates nighttime erections.

Posts.Title: Testosterone study released 7/2/2014

Posts.Content: My husband had the DaVinci on May 9th, 2013. We have sex thanks to Trimix. His erections with that have been as hard or harder than before surgery. We've had a few "oops" where it didn't work, but it's operator error. He has no complaints about the orgasms. Different but good. The orgasm during intercourse after one of the successful shots, was as close to before surgery as he's had. He said he felt a release even though nothing came out. I think the biggest difference is the spontaneity. We have to plan. That is my biggest issue. Can't wake and decide to have a quickie. Since he can only do 3 shots a week, we have to plan. The rest of the time, we have sex while he's soft. He can have an orgasm that way too. Everything else, including the "oops" is much, much, much better than I read it would be and anticipated it to be and worried about. I think one of the reasons is communication and laughter. We talk and laugh, talk and laugh, talk and laugh, talk and laugh, talk and laugh, talk and laugh and talk and laugh some more. Nothing is too serious or sacred. With open and honest communication all things are possible. Laughter diffuses tension and stress. Besides, floppy dicks are soooo cute! lol... I can see the eye rolls all the way in AZ! He does not like the pump, but does it for therapy and believes it helps. He takes daily Cialis to help with blood flow. Use it or lose it! We intend to use it! He is just hit the 3 month mark. Doctor said it's like a toddler in the terrible twos. Things that were going good, stop. He said hang in there and it will get better again.

Posts.Content: The machines are supposed to be calibrated several times a day. So if a test is done right before the calibration and one is done after there will be differences. Even if one is the first test after calibration and the last before the next calibration, it can be different. Looking at trends is the best way. I've had the same test from the same draw for two different doctors and the results were different.

Posts.Content: I believe your medication is losing strength. Why don't you increase the amount you inject? Our pharmacy said Dave can increase the dosage up to 50 units. According to this study, it's only good for 30 days in the refrigerator before the quality is reduced. There is no loss of quality when kept frozen. http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23924676 http://www.stabilis.org/FichesBiblio/1899-recherche page 233: Refrigerated at 4C, alprostadil losses were about 6% in one month and 11% in two months. When frozen at 20C and 70C, losses were similar among the three drugs, with no loss exceeding 5% in six months. Storage of samples at 20C for one month and then subjecting the vials to four freeze/thaw cycles, warming the vials to room temperature each time, resulted in no loss of any of the drugs.

Posts.Content: It's been one year today since Dave's surgery and what a year it's been. I was scared to death but it's all been so much better than I ever dreamed after researching during those months before. Life has changed and our journey has taken different directions. We have a new normal. What hasn't changed is our love and commitment to each other. He has been cancer free so far and will find out next week when the year results are in for the PSA test but I know in my heart it will be zero. He's alive, healthy, happy and I couldn't feel more blessed to be his wife. Bottom line? Life is pretty damn good!

Posts.Content: We need 30-35 grams of fiber to poop good. Too much and you can get constipated. If you don't want to add calories by eating lots of food high in fiber, try Metamucil. It works. Period. There are ways to increase fiber without increasing calories or gaining weight. V8 just came out with a high fiber version and one glass is 5 grams of fiber vs 2 in the regular V8. Calories are the same. raspberries: 1 cup: 8 grams of fiber. only 64 calories Blackberries: 1 cup: 7.6 grams: 62 calories A cup of lentils or black beans are 15 grams. High in protein and healthy. i believe lentils don't cause as much gas as other beans.

Posts.Title: Help for a Spouse

Posts.Content: Great video! I've had colonoscopies for almost 20 years. They are not a big deal. Ok, they aren't fun, but really, not a big deal. Everyone should get them every 5-7 years or when doctor says to. Can I give you guys a hard time? ok, I am anyway. Men whine about the DRE. Seriously. we have that done along with every other orifice checked every year, have our boobs mushed and squeezed till we get tears in our eyes, expel blood from our vagina every month, have colonoscopies when we get to a certain age AND we give birth. So...guys, seriously. A colonscopy and a DRE is not a big deal. Dave whines like it's as bad as his surgery. I hope that ya'll are getting that I have a pretty wise-ass sense of humor.

Posts.Content: My husband's surgery was May 9th. He's not worn a pad for a month and is only having an occasional (less than 2 per day) drip. At night he gets up at 3am to pee and last week stopped laying on a towel. Kegels are a part of his life, every day. He does about 150 per day. He really believe's that is why he's doing so well. So I recommend kegels. lots of kegels. But you can do too many. I think our doc said 150 per day and over 200 may cause muscle soreness and then they are not beneficial. Happy Kegeling! AZ

Posts.Title: PSA results question

Posts.Content: I really don't think about the PSA. But when he called that morning, I got instantly choked up and had a hard time even saying hello. When he told me the tears just started flowing. You really don't realize how bottled up the emotions are inside, even though we talk about it a lot. Now about the Trimix.... Doc said it is most likely the med and not anything Dave is doing wrong. He told him he could go up on the dose to 25-28 and see if that works. Well, yesterday he did 25 and never got hard at all. He would prefill some syringes and leave them in the fridge. Now Dave is thinking he had it in the fridge too long. He has 2 frozen vials and we'll try a new vial. If the new vial doesn't work, he'll take it back and talk to the pharmacist. He also has a new prescription. Venus leakage....doc says that happens to some guys during the nerve healing process and it should stop on it's own. If not, there really isn't anything you can do. Now about testosterone.... doc said 1 more PSA in 3 months. If that is 0, then he'll have Dave do T gel for three months to see if there is a rise in PSA. If not, he'll ok him for pellets. Now about his knee (the list goes on)..... saw that doc right after the urologist and had another MRI. there is a spot that shows the bone has died. Doc said if he wants to take a risk, he could try a partial knee replacement, but it might not work given the ligament damage too. Or he can do a full replacement. Here's the deal....a partial knee replacement will last him his whole life. A full replacement is good for about 15 years. Now about his wife....oh wait...that's another story for another forum somewhere.....

Nerves were spared. 3 month PSA = 0 6 month PSA = 0 I am not a member of the medical industry and anything I say is not intended or implied to be a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis or treatment.

Posts.Title: 9 months.....

Posts.Content: So, as I posted in my 6 month...thread, we had fun. But the curious me is always looking for/at changes. We had some very positive "first times" since surgery happen. Of course, I approach all this objectively and scientifically. Pure medical research. During the Levitra experience, he couldn't get penetrative hard but hard enough to stroke. He was spurting a whitish fluid like he used to spurt ejaculate. It was not during orgasm and it was NOT urine. This is the first time that happened. Could that be from his testicles? I have no idea. We decided to experiment and had him lay down and used a cock ring. It was not the one that comes with the pump. It was a cheap sex toy one that I got for free. lol... don't ask. But! It worked! First time for that too! First time that he stayed hard laying down too! Another thing I've noticed and that many of you have expressed concerns about is length. I'm not sure it's so much length that is lost much as the penis is pulled back into the body a bit. I've noticed with him that the injections get him what I believe is a bigger penis than before surgery, but it doesn't look like it unless his pelvic area is pressed in. I would say that 1-1.5" was added when pressing in on the pelvic area. Subject was surprised as well as he thought he lost length too. Posts.Title: New member sharing PC story and recovery

Posts.Content: My husband (age 62) had DaVinci surgery on May 9th, 2013. Nerves were spared. He healed quickly and without complications. Catheter came out in one week. His doctor had started him on daily Cialis (5mg) 1 month prior to surgery. He is now taking 2.5mgs daily. One week after the cath came out, doctor got him set up with vacuum therapy which he was told to do every day for the first month and 3-5 times per week after that.. One month after surgery he went in for his first Trimix injection. He has not dripped in 3 weeks and has not worn a pad in a month. He does Kegels religiously. PC is not a journey we wanted to take. But we want to share that there is life after surgery. I think one things that helps us is his wife survived breast cancer for 5 years and was then diagnosed with stage 3 ovarian cancer. She fought that for 6 years till she died in 2005. It changed him. It made him realize how fragile life is and he gives thanks for each and every day because you don't know when it will be your last. He said he will not let cancer beat him or define his life. I think another reason we are doing so well is communication. We talk and laugh and talk and laugh and talk and laugh and talk and laugh and then talk and laugh some more. No topic is off limits. No joke too insensitive. We both have a wise-ass sense of humor and will not give that up. We don't judge the other's feelings and emotions. We don't focus on what we lost and can't do but instead, on the future and what we can do. Is sex the same? Yes and No. The spontaneous act of lovemaking or hot, intense sex is gone. We have to plan. So we plan. Is the sex with or without intercourse as satisfying and incredible? ABSOLUTELY! He said the orgasms are great and feel just about the same but without ejaculate. He can have orgasms while completely soft. We laugh about attempts that don't work. We celebrate those that do. Only WE can make our future good. And in spite of PC we are. If anyone wants some tips, please PM me. I'm not sure how much I'm allowed to post here.

Posts.Title: New member sharing PC story and recovery

Posts.Content: After my hysterectomy in 1987, I lost ALL my sex drive and I got old. Very old. I thought old, acted old, dressed old and felt old. After moving to AZ in 2000, I discovered my gyn did hormone pellets. These are made of either estrogen or testosterone and are a little bigger than a grain of rice. She implants them under the skin of my rear in a simple office visit. Within 48 hours my sex drive went from 0 to 160. Desire, arousal, lubrication and orgasm were not only back but incredible. I actually reversed my aging; physically and mentally. I've helped hundreds of women find doctors that do pellets and have the largest support group on the internet. I'm also a moderator on the menopause forum of the same website where I'm active in the prostate cancer forum. These pellets have been around for about 70 years. My dad who had PC cancer in the 90's had estrogen pellets implanted in his stomach. They are FDA approved for men (testosterone only) but not women. Compounding pharmacies make them. Dave had low T and did the pellets for 2 years. He felt great, sex drive improved, erections were like when he was in his 20-30's, he had energy, slept better, had more motivation to work out and a host of other things. Because Testosterone feeds PC, the 3 urologist we spoke to said they were his guardian angel in that they made the cancer grow faster and allowed it to be found so early. Out of 14 cores, they only found a tiny spot on 1 core. After he is cancer free for 9-12 months, they said he can go back on T therapy. that's one reason he did surgery so fast. He loves how he feels.

Posts.Title: Kegals

Posts.Content: I forwarded this to a pharmacist I know. He sent the article on to 5 other doctors and a few pharmacists. Here is the first response: This is a retrospective cohort study which attempts to establish a correlation between the MI endpoint and the two variables listed in men with already pre-existing heart disease and a higher likelihood of MI. Statistical correlation does not equate to causation and this is the trouble with these types of studies. So many questions need to be sorted out before conclusions can be reached such as how bad was the heart disease in each individual, how high was the TT dose, how did diet and lifestyle differ for each, what did the lipid profile for each of these guys look like, what was their family history like, etc., etc., etc. Another cohort study just like this could come up with the exact opposite correlation and be just about as valuable. The important thing for docs is to know their patients well, work not only on their hormones, but also on nutrition and lifestyle changes that will promote good health and avoid progression of heart disease. I would not avoid TT in a man with pre-existing heart disease in order to improve quality of life, but I would inform him that his disease if not pursued aggressively will put him at risk for an event. Hope that helps. Thank you, xxxxxxxx, MD Chair, ACOG Missouri Section Medical Director Women's Strategies Mercy East Community 615 S. New Ballas Road, St. Louis, MO 63141

It is all about managing a patient vs throwing a drug at him and expecting everything to work out. It isn't the T, it is the E1.

His "unit" as he calls it was actually standing at attention. I believe he has venus leakage a bit. He did the shot, got really hard and we had sex. We were an absolute comedy to watch. Remember his knee surgery? Well, try to find an upright position where he doesn't have to be on his knee. Standing at the side of the bed is one, but you can't do that for a long time. Plus he has a difficult time having an orgasm that way. lol we tried a few positions, got stuck in one and couldn't move and and one time I fell over. So once we were done laughing and could actually move, I had him lay down. The erection kind of went down a bit. Not all the way, but noticeably. We finished and once he stood up, he got really, really hard. Lay down go softer, stand up get harder. Anyone else have that happen when laying down? We are very, very happy with the progress! The biggest change I don't like is the loss of spontaneity. But we deal with it.

Posts.Title: Dave's progress

Posts.Content: Glad your over with the surgery and catheter. You wouldn't have been able to reject the cath and have it come out. There is a ball inside that holds it in there. Dave said he swore it was going to come out at times. But when the doc pulled it out, I was amazed at how long it was and that there was the bulb. Make sure you don't wear a damp/wet pad. Once you feel it get damp, it's time to change. First of all, it's dark, hot and with the plastic, it's easy to sweat down there. Yeast thrive in dark, hot and damp. Dave got either diaper rash or jock itch from wearing the pads. Keep talcum powder on down there and the pads dry. If you do get a rash/chafed/irritated try organic coconut oil. That is very healing and fixed Daves. If you don't want to smell like a Pina Colada, get the refractionated and it won't smell.

Posts.Title: Happy Father's Day!

Posts.Content: Will it be the same? Not exactly. Will it be great? Absolutely. Just a different kind of great. Will it be fun again? Absolutely....maybe even more fun or funnier, depending on your sense of humor and communication with your partner. Laugh (or learn how to) at the ups and downs of sex. There will be of moments that with the right frame of mind can make us laugh. We do not expect the pills to work for at least 1 to 2 years. We use the shots and they work really well. Actually, he stays harder longer than before surgery, which I kind of like. I don't think he's complaining. If we don't use a shot, we still play. I have fun giving him what we affectionately call a "floppy dick orgasm". He's not complaining about that either. What I feel we lost.... Spontaneity...early morning sex, sex when you have to see people afterwards, etc is not the most convenient when he has a 2 hour erection. I probably hate that the most. But, it's a small thing in the over all picture. People think nothing of women using vibrators to help with orgasms. In fact, they are really fun! I look at the injection like that for him. Nothing wrong with a little help. We have loved giving each other massages....you know the kind with happy endings? Well, the injection doesn't do well with that and I really hated breaking the "mood" to have him do one when I have him turn over. But we do, and again, he's not complaining. We just do what we need to do. So, there are changes and things we need to do differently, but at the end of the day, we still have the best sex in the world. I think something he said to me sums it up: "We may not make love as often as before surgery, but every time gets better and better, and i love you more and more every day." That's what it's all about!

Posts.Content: Will it be the same? Not exactly. Will it be great? Absolutely. Just a different kind of great. Will it be fun again? Absolutely....maybe even more fun or funnier, depending on your sense of humor and communication with your partner. Laugh (or learn how to) at the ups and downs of sex. There will be of moments that with the right frame of mind can make us laugh. We do not expect the pills to work for at least 1 to 2 years. We use the shots and they work really well. Actually, he stays harder longer than before surgery, which I kind of like. I don't think he's complaining. If we don't use a shot, we still play. I have fun giving him what we affectionately call a "floppy dick orgasm". He's not complaining about that either. What I feel we lost.... Spontaneity...early morning sex, sex when you have to see people afterwards, etc is not the most convenient when he has a 2 hour erection. I probably hate that the most. But, it's a small thing in the over all picture. People think nothing of women using vibrators to help with orgasms. In fact, they are really fun! I look at the injection like that for him. Nothing wrong with a little help. We have loved giving each other massages....you know the kind with happy endings? Well, the injection doesn't do well with that and I really hated breaking the "mood" to have him do one when I have him turn over. But we do, and again, he's not complaining. We just do what we need to do. So, there are changes and things we need to do differently, but at the end of the day, we still have the best sex in the world. I think something he said to me sums it up: "We may not make love as often as before surgery, but every time gets better and better, and i love you more and more every day." That's what it's all about!

Posts.Title: Can your sex life really get back to normal?

Posts.Content: The BRCA gene test is a blood test that uses DNA analysis to identify harmful changes (mutations) in either one of the two breast cancer susceptibility genes  BRCA1 and BRCA2. Women who have inherited mutations in these genes face a much higher risk of developing breast cancer and ovarian cancer compared with the general population. Dave's wife had the BRCA1 gene. She survived breast cancer, but passed away from ovarian cancer. Both of her sisters had breast cancer. We were told that their sons should start PSA tests at 35 as the BRCA can increase the risk of PC in sons. Especially now that Dave has pc. Kind of a double whammy. There is some controversy over that and I found this site that, I think has some good information both for and against. http://prostatecanceruk.org/news/brc...s-myth-busters But my point here, is if you know any women with the BRCA 1 or 2 genes and they have sons, they should be aware of the connection and get tested about age 35.

Posts.Title: Great Balls of Fire

Posts.Content: There are many things that are natural and do help fix things besides prescribed medications. What is wrong with at least trying a natural fix? It took care of hubby's problem. Way too many doctors and non-doctors put down a possible cure that isn't benefiting the big pharma and the doctor's wallets. I used to be more resistant to more natural things, but have a friend that completely believes in them. So far, the things she's told me have worked. For example, I suffer from chronic constipation. For year, my doc said take this drug, take that drug....nothing worked. In addition to the prescribed drugs that did nothing but make me nauseated, I took 3 stool softeners per day and fiber. I ended up having a hemorrhoidectomy that is the most painful surgery I've ever had. They could have cut off my legs with a chain saw and no pain meds and that wouldn't have been as bad. My friend told me about slow release, high quality magnesium. Totally took care of the constipation. If I had known about it years ago, I probably could have avoided the surgery. I told my doc and at first he was resistant and said "they just want to make money from you" and "what works for you doesn't work for everyone". More accurately, he's not making money from natural supplements so he doesn't want to suggest them. After I got pissed and told him he needed to open his mind and close his wallet to big pharma, maybe, just maybe this might help someone else. Guess what? He now has it in his office. After hubby's surgery, they told him to take stool softeners. They did not work. He started taking my magnesium and it worked like a charm. So....open your minds, close your wallets supporting big pharma and just try some natural things. You might just be surprised.

Posts.Title: Day 22, post-operative robotic prostatectomy

Posts.Content: My discussion of the differences between HRT vs. BHRT has nothing to do with whether or not something can be patented. The difference is in the molecular structure and the delivery method which determines how the body uses it. The molecules in HRT from Pregnant Mare's Urine and is NOT the same molecular structure as what the ovaries produce. In BHRT, they are. The proof I need: is does it improve my quality of life? If yes, then it's a choice I make for myself. I have Ankylosing Spondylitis. I do two medications that have very dangerous side effects. One is an injection that is a TNF inhibitor called Enbrel. The other is a cancer drug called Methotrexate. There is no cure for AS, just drugs to improve my quality of life and maybe slow down the progression of the disease. Based on Brad's and Otago's comments, I should not use those drugs either because they have such high side effects including death. My rheumatologist that monitors my AS told me he wanted me off of HRT (Premarin). However, it was about the same time I found BHRT pellets. He approved of the BHRT and the pellets because they bypass my liver and stomach and are not metabolized by them. Because of AS, Enbrel and Metho, my kidneys function at about 60%. My kidney doctor also approves of the BHRT over HRT. Here is some good information about the differences between HRT and BHRT: 1. http://thecompounder.wordpress.com/2...-therapy-bhrt/ 2. The ESTHER Study from France published in Circulation in 2007, showed oral, not transdermal estrogen, was associated with VTE. None of the studies utilizing subcutaneous hormone pellet therapy have shown an increase risk of VTE, heart attack, stroke, or breast cancer. In addition, the WHI did not utilize any of these preparations and therefore conclusions about subcutaneous hormone pellet therapy cannot be made based on WHI data. Ronald Young, MD, a prominent Houston Ob-Gyn, and an investigator in the HERS Study and the WHI, in a recent interview agreed the WHI was flawed. He stated you just don't give estrogen in those doses to women at that age (average age of women in WHI was 64) very often. 3. http://www.differencebetween.net/sci...-hrt-and-bhrt/ 4. http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3131235/ I am trying to upload a PDF with some studies, however, I'm running into problems. I'll keep trying.

Posts.Title: Stupid ignorant doctors!

Posts.Content: I made a mistake with his age. He's 60. He has his prostate. His urologist did his PSA several years ago before pellets and it was zero. This guy is going to tell his him he wants it tested in October when he sees him. I think the thing that bothers me the most is a doctor telling a guy he has zero chance of getting prostate cancer. No one can say that with 100% assurance. The second thing is not testing PSA when a guy is doing T therapy. Irresponsible in my opinion. Yes, I have been getting estradiol and testosterone pellets for 9 years. Although testosterone converts to estrogen, it doesn't convert enough in women to rely on it alone. Too much or too little of either causes symptoms which can be the same.

Posts.Content: Dave has dry orgasms. He says they feel good but different. I asked if they were satisfying. He said yes. However, the last time he used the injection he said he felt like there was a release to his orgasm. He said it felt almost like a pre-surgical one. He did say too, that the orgasm while he was hard was better than when soft. I did not detect anything in me, so I don't think anything actually came out. My ex did not have PC cancer, but did have an elevated PSA and probably prostatitis (sp?). He also had dry orgasms on occasion. I know you guys miss ejaculating. I can't speak for other women, but I miss it too. I think guys usually have one kind of orgasm. I'm not sure if some can be stronger or weaker than others. I've asked him as well, if orgasms during intercourse feel different than manual or oral. lol...He looks at me like I'm crazy (he's not far off!) and says "it's an orgasm!". Women have many different kinds. Clitoral, vaginal, uterine, cervical and the always mysterious g-spot. We also have NBN (no battery needed) orgasms from manual or oral and a host of different kinds of vibes which give different sensations. Some of my friends that have also had a total hysterectomy (TAH-BSO) swear that they had uterine orgasms before surgery and after surgery orgasms are a blip and not a tidal wave.

Posts.Title: Forum unstable - Too many sticky's?

Posts.Content: I am an internet junky, as in I reasearch for hours/days/years topics I need to know about. I want to be an informed patient with my doctors and my husband's doctors. I don't take what they say as gospel. I question and question again. That being said, I would like to make a comment about doctors, forums and our health. As a moderator of a menopause forum, forum owner, owner of several Yahoo groups and a participant of many forums for lots of different topics, please remember that in your research following diagnosis or treatment, the many posters in any kind of forum are those not doing well, are searching for answers, need help, are scared and maybe depressed and desperate. The vast majority of people that are doing great are living their lives are not posting on forums and groups. There are some of us that have made helping others a passion and we are also out there posting or even starting support groups for others. When my husband was first diagnosed, I was alone in a hotel on a business trip for a week. I spent every night researching (even knowing I shouldn't) about PC. I cried myself to sleep every night too. I thought our lives were basically over. I dreaded the last 2 weeks prior to surgery and didn't handle the thought of our last time making love very well. Well guess what? There is life after PC surgery! He's doing well, not leaking like a firehose as I read he would. Our sex life is still awesome. I won't say things haven't changed, but it's still awesome. So, please try (I know it's hard) to keep a positive outlook. I know you are scared but post treatment life may not be as bad as you read about in forums and on websites. We have found that to be true. Does life take a different road? Yep, and the road can and will be bumpy. But not as bad as I or he expected.

Posts.Content: My discussion of the differences between HRT vs. BHRT has nothing to do with whether or not something can be patented. The difference is in the molecular structure and the delivery method which determines how the body uses it. The molecules in HRT from Pregnant Mare's Urine and is NOT the same molecular structure as what the ovaries produce. In BHRT, they are. The proof I need: is does it improve my quality of life? If yes, then it's a choice I make for myself. I have Ankylosing Spondylitis. I do two medications that have very dangerous side effects. One is an injection that is a TNF inhibitor called Enbrel. The other is a cancer drug called Methotrexate. There is no cure for AS, just drugs to improve my quality of life and maybe slow down the progression of the disease. Based on Brad's and Otago's comments, I should not use those drugs either because they have such high side effects including death. My rheumatologist that monitors my AS told me he wanted me off of HRT (Premarin). However, it was about the same time I found BHRT pellets. He approved of the BHRT and the pellets because they bypass my liver and stomach and are not metabolized by them. Because of AS, Enbrel and Metho, my kidneys function at about 60%. My kidney doctor also approves of the BHRT over HRT. Here is some good information about the differences between HRT and BHRT: 1. http://thecompounder.wordpress.com/2...-therapy-bhrt/ 2. The ESTHER Study from France published in Circulation in 2007, showed oral, not transdermal estrogen, was associated with VTE. None of the studies utilizing subcutaneous hormone pellet therapy have shown an increase risk of VTE, heart attack, stroke, or breast cancer. In addition, the WHI did not utilize any of these preparations and therefore conclusions about subcutaneous hormone pellet therapy cannot be made based on WHI data. Ronald Young, MD, a prominent Houston Ob-Gyn, and an investigator in the HERS Study and the WHI, in a recent interview agreed the WHI was flawed. He stated you just don't give estrogen in those doses to women at that age (average age of women in WHI was 64) very often. 3. http://www.differencebetween.net/sci...-hrt-and-bhrt/ 4. http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3131235/ I am trying to upload a PDF with some studies, however, I'm running into problems. I'll keep trying.

Posts.Title: Vacation is over--casodex and lupron on the menu

Posts.Content: It all depends on the pathology of what they remove. Even at than, most doctors won't give T therapy until 9 months to a year after surgery and no dectable PSA. My husband got the testosterone pellets for 2 years prior to diagnosis. He so much wants to go back on them and as long as his PSA is non-dectable, he can maybe after 9 months. The pellets are tiny compressed pellets that are inserted under the skin of the rear. His PSA was 197 before he started and it was raised to about 1000 after insert. He got them about every 4-5 months.

Posts.Title: Testosterone After PC Surgery

Posts.Content: Dave has dry orgasms. He says they feel good but different. I asked if they were satisfying. He said yes. However, the last time he used the injection he said he felt like there was a release to his orgasm. He said it felt almost like a pre-surgical one. He did say too, that the orgasm while he was hard was better than when soft. I did not detect anything in me, so I don't think anything actually came out. My ex did not have PC cancer, but did have an elevated PSA and probably prostatitis (sp?). He also had dry orgasms on occasion. I know you guys miss ejaculating. I can't speak for other women, but I miss it too. I think guys usually have one kind of orgasm. I'm not sure if some can be stronger or weaker than others. I've asked him as well, if orgasms during intercourse feel different than manual or oral. lol...He looks at me like I'm crazy (he's not far off!) and says "it's an orgasm!". Women have many different kinds. Clitoral, vaginal, uterine, cervical and the always mysterious g-spot. We also have NBN (no battery needed) orgasms from manual or oral and a host of different kinds of vibes which give different sensations. Some of my friends that have also had a total hysterectomy (TAH-BSO) swear that they had uterine orgasms before surgery and after surgery orgasms are a blip and not a tidal wave.

Posts.Title: Trimix

Posts.Content: There is some trial and error in doing the shot. So don't be frustrated or disappointed if things don't work like you think they will until you get the technique down. Some use the pump prior (BUT NEVER AFTER) injecting to help locate the correct spot. Don't do too much. Start low and work your way up. Dave's first dose was .05. But he's settled in at .15 for the correct dose. He went up .01-.02 at a time. It's important to remain upright and massaging the area for upwards of 5 minutes.

Posts.Title: Dry Orgasms

Posts.Content: Testosterone does fuel prostate cancer. All 3 surgeons we talked with, told us T therapy was our "guardian angel" and is what allowed it to be found so very early instead of slowly growing for long time and being more advanced. Out of 14 core biopsy, only 1 very tiny spot was found and post surgical patholgy confirmed it was contained. We also believe in quality of life over quantity of life. I would rather feet great and have a great life and live shorter instead of a hot flash, night sweat, no sex drive, irrtable, moody, can't sleep life of hormonal hell. His parents are 91 and 89. They've been married for 68 years. I can tell you they are not enjoying life much. they are not able to travel anymore or do much of anything. Most of their friends are gone. I'd rather do hormones and live life to the fullest and be extremely sexual, than not doing hormones and living than that. Dave feels the same. We might be different than most, but I want to go out with gusto!

Posts.Title: Prostate cancer and sex drive

Posts.Content: I would get your Free and Total testosterone levels checked. If below 450-500, then yes, your libido could be affected. How have your PSA levels been since your surgery? If non-dectectable, then I would talk to your doctor about testosterone therapy. Not all believe in it, but many do now. Not only will it help with that, but Testosterone helps with so many other things like bone density, mood, concentration, muscle mass, strength, insomnia, energy, a sense of well being, low T raises risk of cardiovascular disease. My husband LOVED being on T therapy in the form of subcutaneous pellets. And actually, we're glad he was as that was how we were able to discover the PC as early as we did. As soon as he can, he will go back on it. Hopefully after the first of the year.

Posts.Title: OT: Pharmacies and Security

Posts.Content: Sorry Brave, I have to respectfully disagree with you. Neither are pharmacists and I've found that doctors know squat about drugs. If you really want to know about a drug, ask a pharmacist, specifically the pharmacist that made it. The pharmacist that makes our Trimix has "keep frozen" on the package. So who really knows more about the drug? A doctor that really only prescribes a drug that goes with a condition or a pharmacist that makes it. In my long list of drugs and medical conditions that I have, my money is on the pharmacist. I have learned so much more about when, how, with what to take drugs from my pharamcist then I ever have from my doctors. Here is a study that was done on Trimix. -About 8% alprostadil loss occurred in five days at room temperature; -Under refrigeration losses of about 6% and 11% occurred after 1 and 2 months, respectively. -Frozen at -20C and -70C, less than 5% loss of any of the drug components occurred in 6 months. http://www.ijpc.com/abstracts/abstract.cfm?ABS=1799

Posts.Title: Do Not Freeze Trimix

Posts.Content: Just found this post on another forum: SUCCESS WITH FROZEN TRIMIX! I am 38 months out from DaVinci RP and have been using Trimix since month 8. I wanted to share with you some factual news regarding frozen Trimix that I can personally attest to. about July 1, 2008 I purchased a new mix from a local specialty pharmacy in the St. Louis area. When I arrived to pick the prescription, the pharmacist made me aware he had reduced the price to $50 for a 10cc bottle because the material was within two week of “expiration”. In addition, knowing that he most probably would not be able to sell some of the remaining mix by this expiration date he asked if I would be interested in taking another 10cc bottle with the mix frozen. For free? Why not and $50 for 20cc if it all worked out. Having freezer packs with me in a cooler I headed home with a smile. The first bottle lasted me from that date of purchase until the last drop was used on March 31, 2010. Mind you that the dosage gradually had to be increased as time went on with 0.10cc being the max. For 20 months the 10cc bottle did well with solid performance. It was time for the frozen Trimix and I was excited to see what the results were going to be. I started the first injection with 0.06cc. It worked with excellence but a little heavy on the dosage amount. Very firm for over four hours but somewhat pleasant. More annoying then anything else and it faded slowly with no alarm or Sudafed. I have been there before on overdose and I new I was not in that situation so all went OK. After a few more injections I am down to 0.03cc with very firm erections. I will reduce this amount to check on the results but I believe I am on the edge. I think it will be OK but will require more stimulation. I presume I have about 20 months on the 10cc bottle also. All in all, this is probably the best bargain that I will ever come across for Trimix. Moral of the factual story is two fold, don’t let the expiration date fool you and don’t be afraid to use good frozen Trimix!

Posts.Title: Do Not Freeze Trimix

Posts.Content: Another note on freezing from The Compounder: http://www.thecompounder.com/alterna...-mix-injection Storage and stability. The mixture is not stable for long periods. That is the primary reason that it is not available as a commercial drug product. Our studies indicate that frozen preparations are stable for a year  maybe more. Once thawed, the stability falls to just a few weeks. If kept under refrigeration, the amounts we dispense are easily used up before they lose potency. It is important to note that improper storage does not result in harmful chemicals in the preparation. The only thing to suffer is the potency  the preparation may not be as strong as when fresh. It may not elicit the expected results. We are often asked about problems if the preparation is left at room temperature. Thats somewhat complicated because what I consider room temperature may not agree with your definition. At best, expect the potency to last about three days. This is another good reason to ask that your prescription be dispensed in pre-filled syringes. A single dose can be removed from the refrigerator and there isnt the risk that the remaining doses will inadvertently be left out.

Posts.Content: Thank you all! I am profoundly grateful for what Dave and I have and am usually so focused on the positive and moving forward. I am a big believer that everything happens for a reason and timing is everything. Why did I read that email when I usually pass it by? She had replied to a monthly "stay positive" email so the subject wasn't even a draw to me. I never thought of the term survivor guilt....that creature does pop up once in a while but usually in connection with Dave's wife. I think the timing of the email last night is what hit me in the face. Dave wants me to leave the group because of how emotional I get and focus of the positive. We'll see. He "flew" as they say early this morning about 1am. She had left the hospital before to go home and take care of an adult disabled son so he was alone. My God, I can't imagine. I'm not a stranger to death. I have had to make the decision to remove life support 4 times with various relatives. Sometimes alone, sometimes with relatives. I don't know why this one got to me so much. There is a reason it did.

Posts.Title: Reality check...

Posts.Content: I want to tell you all how honored I am to have found this group. You let me pretty much say what I want, make fun, get pissed, talk about my favorite subject and help if I can. Right now I want to scream at the top of my lungs that I HATE THIS F***ING DISEASE! Dave and I just had some fun in bed. Really good fun in bed. Then I read an email from a woman in a group I'm in for wives of pc guys. Talk about a slap in the face of reality. I don't feel I belong there as most of them have lost their husbands or they have more advanced cancer. I have not read an email or posted in the group for months. I have no idea what made me read the latest email, but I did. This woman's husband slipped into unconsciousness yesterday and they expect him to "fly" as they say any minute. She says he isn't going to die from pc, but from the treatment of it. I'm crying and can't stop. I feel guilty because Dave is doing so well and others are not. I feel guilty because we have such a great sex life and others struggle. I feel guilty because his deceased wife should be here with him instead of me to finish out their lives and be able to enjoy their grandkids. I'm pissed because none of you should have cancer. None of us deserve any disease. I'm in awe of those women...their strength, calmness, determination, peace of mind, seemingly acceptance and well, everything. I can't even begin to comprehend how they feel. They are my role models. I thank God every day for Dave and that he is cancer free. What I really want to do is have a "come to Jesus" meeting with God about it all. Thank you guys, for letting me vent. You are the best. Hugs to all of you.... Nancy

Posts.Title: Reality check...

Posts.Content: I know my mouth has very few filters and I say things others are thinking. Oh well, here goes.... I know it feels like the worst thing ever to leak during orgasm, regardless if it's a drip or a blast. But honestly? Just enjoy the sensation and go with it. It's not going to hurt anyone so you clean it up and go on. Most women leak urine at some time during sex or orgasm. I have. I think there can even be some urine in semen at times. A friend that had pc surgery 2 years ago said during orgasm, he leaked like a fire hose in the beginning. His wife squirts. So they joke about having shooting contests. Ok, maybe a bit too much out there for most of you, but the point is, don't let it scare you or depress you or make you feel bad. At least you are having orgasms which is the best part! Also, if guys are freaked out about it, than wives may react the same way. So relax and go with the flow. Sorry, for the pun! lol...no I'm not! Guys, it's just pee!

Posts.Content: Our first try with Trimix was a low dose in the docs office of .05. It gave him about a 50% erection. He stays hard for about 2 hours but after orgasm would prefer it to go down as he gets so sensitive. We love it and aside from the lack of spontaneity, I am glad we can use it. He stays hard for about 2 hours but after orgasm would prefer it to go down as he gets so sensitive. We love it and aside from the lack of spontaneity, I am glad we can use it. Posts.Content: I prefer to see D.O.'s as they are trained to treat the whole body. They will spend more time talking and instead of focusing on the particular, will look at how the whole body affects disease. D.O. physicians complete conventional residencies in hospitals and training programs, are licensed in all states, and have rights and responsibilities, such as military service, that are identical to M.D. physicians and surgeons. Insurance companies cover DO's. http://www.mayoclinic.org/osteopath/...s/FAQ-20058168 http://piedmont.org/patient-tools/Li...nd-DO-697.aspx
